title: Customer Appears To Put Armpit Hair In Own Food To Avoid Paying Bill At Sydney Restaurant | 10 News
description: A Sydney restaurant has been left disgusted after discovering security video it believes shows a customer planting his underarm hair in his own meal. Pony Dining in The Rocks says the apparent grotesque act was a deliberate move to avoid footing the expensive bill. title: Police Watchdog To Probe NSW Police Response To Sydney Anti-Herzog Protest | 10 News
description: Police have admitted a communication mishap led to one of the violent scenes at the anti-Herzog protest at Town Hall on Monday night. A surge of complaints and videos of officers aggressively arresting and moving on protesters has now prompted an independent investigation by the watchdog. title: Man Charged Over Terrifying Chainsaw Rampage In Melbourne | 10 News
description: A 43-year-old man has been charged over a terrifying rampage involving a chainsaw attack on the front security door of a Point Cook home. Fearing for his life, the alleged victim says he was forced to arm himself with his own chainsaw as he waited for police to arrive. title: Your DNA Could Be Used To Catch A Killer | 10 News+

title: Pauline Hanson On What The Liberal Leadership Spill Could Mean For One Nation | 10 News+
description: Sussan Ley's resignation from Parliament means a by-election is coming in her vast regional seat in southern New South Wales. It will prove a big test for newly elected Liberal Party leader Angus Taylor and One Nation. 10 News+ speaks to Pauline Hanson about whether her party can triumph in a “real” vote. title: How To Spot And Protect Yourself From Online Romance Scams This Valentine's Day | 10 News+
description: There is a warning tonight for lonely hearts looking for love online this Valentine's Day. There were more than 3,000 scams reported in 2025, 21 per cent more than the previous year, with victims swindled out of an eyewatering $28 million. So, what are the red flags to look out for? title: The Palestinian & Israeli Duo Working In Australia Towards Diplomacy In The Middle East | 10 News+
description: A Palestinian nurse and Israeli occupational therapist are visiting hospitals in Australia as part of a program that aims to build confidence across the deeply divided lines of the Middle East. Carrie Greenbank sat down with the duo who are committed to what they call "health diplomacy”.
